intro: Cynanchum lineare subsp. lineare, commonly known as the linear milkvetch, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, cylindrical stems that are often hairy. The leaves are alternate, linear, and slightly hairy, with a bluish-green color. Its small, greenish-white flowers are arranged in racemes and bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
